mission: ^I announced, presenting the jewel to the queen with a deep bow.
^"Good job. I needed a gem suitable for the replacement set, even when I lose one."
^"You see, I have a particular fondness for my jewelry."
^The queen confessed, her eyes gleaming with appreciation for the precious stones that adorned her regal attire.
^"Why did you take interest in me?"
^I questioned, eager to understand the motivations behind her mysterious request.
^"Cut to the chase, do you? What is your name anyway?"
^She redirected, a playful smile dancing on her lips as she occupied her medieval throne.
^I replied, standing in the presence of royalty and sensing there was more to the queen's story than met the eye.
^"No one addresses me by my name, and neither should you. However, my name is Suiko."
^"As you may know, I'm the king's wife. I reside in the prettiest castle, surrounded by gems and beautiful jewelry. My life is a fairy tale, or is it?"
^Her theatrical way of speaking reminded me of drama novels, a genre I wouldn't consider my favorite.
^"No. It is no fairy tale. Let me share a secret with you, Freya."
^"The king is a brute. He cheats, never takes care of me apart from those beautiful jewels," Suiko confessed, her words laden with the weight of unspoken truths.
^"That must be the reason you are so focused on them. They are the only things that bring you company."
^I deduced, recognizing the loneliness hidden behind her regal facade.
^After that, she fell into a contemplative silence. I gazed at her, uncertain of how to proceed, when a single tear rolled down her cheek.
^She said, shooing me away with a regal wave of her hand.
^Respecting her request, I left the queen alone, her tears echoing the silent struggles beneath the veneer of royalty and the opulent throne she occupied.
